user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_connection_close_:
```c
void
MHD_connection_close_ (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                       enum MHD_RequestTerminationCode termination_code)
{
  struct MHD_Daemon *daemon = connection->daemon;
  struct MHD_Response *resp = connection->rp.response;

  mhd_assert (! connection->suspended);
#ifdef MHD_USE_THREADS
  mhd_assert ( (! MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon)) || \
               MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_current_thread_ (connection->tid) );
#endif /* MHD_USE_THREADS */
  if ( (NULL != daemon->notify_completed) &&
       (connection->rq.client_aware) )
    daemon->notify_completed (daemon->notify_completed_cls,
                              connection,
                              &connection->rq.client_context,
                              termination_code);
  connection->rq.client_aware = false;
  if (NULL != resp)
  {
    connection->rp.response = NULL;
    MHD_destroy_response (resp);
  }
  if (NULL != connection->pool)
  {
    MHD_pool_destroy (connection->pool);
    connection->pool = NULL;
  }

  MHD_connection_mark_closed_ (connection);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Fragments not listed are simple local assignments, initializations, or condition checks that do not themselves introduce unreachable code (e.g. declarations, setting local variables, simple assignment to connection->rq.client_aware = false). The selected fragments are places that must be investigated for potential unreachable-code violations: assertions and conditional callbacks which may abort/terminate, and calls to external functions (notify_completed, MHD_destroy_response, MHD_pool_destroy, MHD_connection_mark_closed_) whose implementation could not return (e.g. call exit/longjmp/abort) or otherwise make subsequent statements unreachable. The conditional compilation block is included because assertion behavior under MHD_USE_THREADS needs checking. Other lines do not contain control-flow constructs or calls that could make later code unreachable, so they do not require further investigation for Rule 2.1.
